query-text: do viscous effects seriously modify pressure distributions .

In the context of pressure distributions, viscous effects lead to the development of boundary layers along solid surfaces in the flow. These boundary layers have a lower velocity compared to the main flow, leading to a decrease in pressure within the boundary layer. This results in a pressure gradient across the boundary layer, which in turn affects the overall pressure distribution in the flow field.

Therefore, viscous effects play a significant role in modifying pressure distributions in fluid flow, particularly near solid surfaces where boundary layers develop. It is important to consider these effects in engineering applications to accurately predict the behavior of fluids in various systems.
